A '''pale moss carpet''' is a block that causes vine-like pale moss to grow on the side of neighboring blocks.

== Obtaining ==
=== Breaking ===
Pale moss carpets can be mined using any tool or by hand, but a [[hoe]] is the quickest way to break it.

{{breaking row|horizontal=1|Pale Moss Carpet|link=none|Hoe}}

=== Natural generation ===
Pale moss carpets can be found on [[Pale moss patch|pale moss patches]] inside of [[pale garden]]s.

{{Block distribution}}

=== Crafting ===
{{Crafting
 |A3= Pale Moss Block
 |B3= Pale Moss Block
 |Output= Pale Moss Carpet,3
 |type= Decoration blocks
}}

=== Post-generation ===
{{Control|Using}} [[bone meal]] on a [[pale moss block]] has a chance to grow pale moss carpets.

== Usage ==
{{FakeImage|{{Animate|Pale Moss Carpet (low).png;Pale Moss Carpet (tall).png|150px}}|The decorative vine appearing onto the adjacent surfaces.}}

Similar to [[moss carpet]]s, pale moss carpets have most of the properties of the standard [[carpet]]s, cannot be pushed by [[piston]]s, cannot be equipped on [[llama]]s, and do not occlude [[Sculk Sensor#Vibration detection|vibration]]s from [[sculk sensor]]s.

When placed next to a block, the pale moss carpet causes a vine texture to appear on the block's adjacent surfaces. If a second block is stacked above, when placed, the pale moss carpet has a 50% chance to cause a two block tall vine texture to appear. The player may {{control|break}} the second vine texture to keep it at one block tall, or {{control|use}} [[bone meal]] on the carpet or the first vine texture to grow the second vine texture.

=== Composting ===
Placing a pale moss carpet into a [[composter]] has a 30% chance of raising the compost level by 1.
